instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-02100: What is 820-02100? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck at 5v
threads.message: <SIGNAL>3V8_AON_SPMU</SIGNAL> was shorted to ground after a liquid spill and the rail was restored after removing a burned capacitor.  The board booted up fine and everything worked until the next day when the display had no backlight. I probed around UP800 and must've shorted something else because now ppdcin is 5v.  I'm not familiar with the power sequence of the non-intel boards

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck at 5v
threads.message: Compare diode mode readings on secondary power rails with good board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck at 5v
threads.message: i don't have another board to compare readings . <SIGNAL>PP1V8_S2</SIGNAL> is 6 ohms to ground

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck at 5v
threads.message: <CHIP>U8100</CHIP> is shorted. Can these be ordered in the states? I was hoping to get one quickly

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck at 5v
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck at 5v
threads.message: i've replaced <CHIP>U8100</CHIP> and the  short on <SIGNAL>1V8_S2</SIGNAL> is gone but i don't know if <CHIP>U8100</CHIP> is attached correctly. what can i measure to check?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck at 5v
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck at 5v
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck at 5v
threads.message:
Do you have stable LDOs?
Check on slave PMU too.

Is the machine recognized in DFU mode?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck at 5v
threads.message: after reviving with apple configurator i get  "DFU state to DFU state. [com.apple.MobileDevice.MobileRestore â€“ 0xFCA (4042)"

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck at 5v
threads.message:
Check for any short on UP800 area.
Try DFU disconnecting internal LCD.

Be sure to connect charger cable before DFU cable.
Also test with both charger and battery connected.
You may need to try restore option too; it will erase SSD!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck at 5v
threads.message: i think i might've shorted the processor. i tested  <SIGNAL>PP1V8_S1_CLVR_VDDH</SIGNAL> by injecting 1.8volts. the voltage on the dc supply drops and the amps goes to max but nothing gets visibly warm on the thermal camera
